page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE OLDEST HOUSE IN GWENT IS IN THE N.W. CORNER OF THE BLOCK,THIS IS WERNDDU BLACK MARSH BUILT IN THE 12TH CENTURY,THOUGH LITTLE OF THE OLD HOUSE REMAINS VISIBLE,JUST AN OAK STAIRCASE. UNTIL 100 YEARS AGO THIS WAS THE SEAT OF THE ELDEST BRANCH OF THE HERBERT FAMILY. WHEN FIRST BUILT IT WAS THE ONLY HOUSE BETWEEN MONMOUTH AND ABERGAVENNY, BUT LATER HORSE DRAWN COACHES PASSED THE DOOR UNTIL ONE OWNER DIVERTED THE ROAD CAUSING BRYNGWENIN TO BE LEFT AS A CUL-DE-SAC. AT CHURCH FARM IN THE S.E. CORNER OF THE BLOCK 12 SOCKETED BRONZE AXES,3000 YEARS OLD, WERE FOUND EARLY IN 20TH CENTURY. TWO FORMER PUBLIC HOUSES ON THE OLD MONMOUTH - ABERGAVENNY ROAD STILL RETAIN THEIR ORIGINAL NAMES, 'THE WHITE SWAN'AND 'THE PLOUGH'.
